channel.title: Recompile with -xlint popup?

how do i fix that? all i added was the ::sub command. the server runs and everything but i can forsee future problems

item.title: Recompile with -xlint popup?
item.dc:creator: @darscape darscape
item.description:
@darscape wrote:

Food for the troll.

Read full topic

item.title: Recompile with -xlint popup?
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

Snoopy you shouldn’t post if you have no idea what you are talking about.

Like adu said:

adu:

Xlint isn’t an error, its a warning to tell you that the some parts of the code is using methods/conventions that have been deprecated by the API.

You really don’t need to worry about it at all

Read full topic

item.title: Recompile with -xlint popup?
item.dc:creator: @snoopy89 snoopy89
item.description:
@snoopy89 wrote:

I was wondering if it is somehting to care about Adam? That msg recompile with -xlint to see detajls.

Ive seen it gives the same msg to an utouched rscd version.

Read full topic

item.title: Recompile with -xlint popup?
item.dc:creator: @adu adu
item.description:
@adu wrote:

[quote=“da real hype, post:5, topic:318020”]all i added was the sub command, i should be safe if i keep it? if i add somehting in the future that x-lint will not mess anything up? thats the way im taking it

ty adu u been very helpful to me :D[/quote]

Its just a warning, it won’t affect anything if its there or not there. If you’r really concerned, you can look through command handler and see whats causing it but i highly doubt that it is the sub command that I made because it was very basic.

To sum up, it dosent matter if those warnings there, it wont “mess up” anything, its just a warning - nothing more.

Read full topic

item.title: Recompile with -xlint popup?

item.description:
@da_real_hype wrote:

all i added was the sub command, i should be safe if i keep it? if i add somehting in the future that x-lint will not mess anything up? thats the way im taking it

item.title: Recompile with -xlint popup?
item.dc:creator: @adu adu
item.description:
@adu wrote:

Xlint isn’t an error, its a warning to tell you that the some parts of the code is using methods/conventions that have been deprecated by the API. For more in depth information you can compile with -xlint right before your classpath.

[quote=“snoopy89, post:2, topic:318020”]stop terrorizing this section, Its all fun to run a server but you shouldn’t try.

javac -xlint , its a compile command, and it doesn’t work with Ant.

And its clearly pointing at commandhandle.java.[/quote]

That is incorrect, you can use it with ant. All you would need todois modify your build file and add [tt] [/tt]

Read full topic
